page.title: 10ST.GEORGE'S CHURCH,BRAILES.
page.content:
Our magnificent Parish Church is known as the{Cathedral of the Feldon- the field land of South Warwickshire. The tower, 110 feet high, is a local landmark.Most of the present building is 14th Century though the first Vicar was instituted in 1153 and there was certainly a Saxon church on the site before that.
Children's Impressions:-
One of the lovely stained glass windows is called the "Children's Window"and is devoted to 37 children who died of diptheria in 1876.The font is 600 years old and has eight sides, each with a different pattern carved in stone.The great Organ has hundreds of pipes in it and was built when the church was restored in 1879.
